definition: to brook no delay/to demand immediate action
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: There will be no retrospective global agreement to undo the damage we have caused.
sentences.chinese: 全球一致採取行動治理我們已經造成的損害刻不容緩。

sentences.english: So it is no time to delay to improve the quality of accounting information(QAI).
sentences.chinese: 治理會計信息失真，提高會計信息質量已刻不容緩。

sentences.english: So it is very necessary to define the concept of personal dangerousness.
sentences.chinese: 因此，正確廓清人身危險性的概念是刻不容緩的。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is urgency for selenium resources to be reinforced exploration, exploitation and utilization.
sentences.chinese: 在我國加強硒礦資源的勘查和開發利用已刻不容緩。

sentences.english: It is imperative for us to recover the initiative in diplomacy .
sentences.chinese: 恢復外交主權已屬刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Therefore, there is no time to delay for the bio-piracy inhibition.
sentences.chinese: 因此，對我國而言，遏制生物剽竊刻不容緩。

sentences.english: So, it is of great urgency to rescue and protect soil resources.
sentences.chinese: 拯救和保護土壤資源刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Special formulate superintends the legal no time to delay of the network.
sentences.chinese: 專門制訂監管網絡的法律刻不容緩。

sentences.english: It thinks that sawing the national folk cultural heritage in HeiLongJiang province is a ta…
sentences.chinese: 認爲，搶救黑土地民族民間文化遺產工作刻不容緩。

sentences.english: So we should change the behindhand situation and resolve the two main problems as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 因而，改變國內的落後現狀和解決兩大問題刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Development of cathode blocks of high quality is an urgent task for us.
sentences.chinese: 開發高質量的陰極炭塊已是我們刻不容緩的任務。

sentences.english: Today, it is urgent to constitute a kind of culturology based on the paradigm of dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 在當代，建立對話的文化學已刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Therefore, Zoucheng human resources management research has become a pressing issue.
sentences.chinese: 因此，鄒城市人才資源管理研究成爲刻不容緩的課題。

sentences.english: We must deliver with a sense of urgency.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須刻不容緩地履行諾言。

sentences.english: It is the time for us to take the effective measures to protect it.
sentences.chinese: 對金頭閉殼龜採取切實有效的保護措施已刻不容緩。

definition: top priority job/matter of vital importance
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to relieve disaster/to help disaster victims
golden years (after the age of about 60)
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
